attributes.text:
A simple tree data model used as the table model

The object structure of a single node of the tree is:

{
  // USER-PROVIDED ATTRIBUTES
  // ------------------------
  type           : qx.ui.treevirtual.MTreePrimitive.Type.LEAF,
  parentNodeId   : 23,    // index of the parent node in _nodeArr

  label          : "My Documents",
  bSelected      : true,  // true if node is selected; false otherwise.
  bOpened        : true,  // true (-), false (+)
  bHideOpenClose : false, // whether to hide the open/close button
  icon           : "images/folder.gif",
  iconSelected   : "images/folder_selected.gif",

  cellStyle      : "background-color:cyan"
  labelStyle     : "background-color:red;color:white"

  // USER-PROVIDED COLUMN DATA
  columnData     : [
                     null, // null at index of tree column (typically 0)
                     "text of column 1",
                     "text of column 2"
                   ],

  // APPLICATION-, MIXIN-, and SUBCLASS-PROVIDED CUSTOM DATA
  data           : {
                     application :
                     {
                         // application-specific user data goes in here
                         foo: "bar",
                         ...
                     },
                     MDragAndDropSupport :
                     {
                         // Data required for the Drag & Drop mixin.
                         // When a mixin is included, its constructor
                         // should create this object, named according
                         // to the mixin or subclass name (empty or
                         // otherwise)
                     },
                     ... // Additional mixins or subclasses.
                   },

  // INTERNALLY-CALCULATED ATTRIBUTES
  // --------------------------------
  // The following properties need not (and should not) be set by the
  // caller, but are automatically calculated.  Some are used internally,
  // while others may be of use to event listeners.

  nodeId         : 42,   // The index in _nodeArr, useful to event listeners.
  children       : [ ],  // each value is an index into _nodeArr

  level          : 2,    // The indentation level of this tree node

  bFirstChild    : true,
  lastChild      : [ false ],  // Array where the index is the column of
                               // indentation, and the value is a boolean.
                               // These are used to locate the
                               // appropriate "tree line" icon.
}
Clear all selections in the data model. This method does not clear selections displayed in the widget, and is intended for internal use, not by users of this class.
The node id of the parent of the node being added
The string to display as the label for this node
True if the branch should be rendered in its opened state; false otherwise.
True if the open/close button should not be displayed; false if the open/close button should be displayed
The relative (subject to alias expansion) or full path of the icon to display for this node when it is not a selected node.
The relative (subject to alias expansion) or full path of the icon to display for this node when it is a selected node.
Add a branch to the tree.
The node id of the newly-added branch.
The node id of the parent of the node being added
The string to display as the label for this node
The relative (subject to alias expansion) or full path of the icon to display for this node when it is not a selected node.
The relative (subject to alias expansion) or full path of the icon to display for this node when it is a selected node.
Add a leaf to the tree.
The node id of the newly-added leaf.
Clears the tree of all nodes
A node identifier, as previously returned by {@link #addBranch} or {@link #addLeaf}.
The column number to which the provided data applies
Retrieve the data from an additional column (a column other than the tree column) of the tree.
The cell data for the specified column
Return the array of node data.
Array of node objects. See {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataModel} for a description nodes in this array.
The index of the row.
Returns the node object specific to a currently visible row. In this simple tree data model, that’s the same as retrieving the value of the tree column of the specified row.
Thrown if the row index is out of bounds.
The node object associated with the specified row.
zero-based row index.
This operation maps rowIndexes to nodes. It does the opposite job to {@link #getRowFromNodeId}. This function is useful to map selection (row based) to nodes.
node associated to rowIndex.
Return the mapping of nodes to rendered rows. This function is intended for use by the cell renderer, not by users of this class. It is also useful to select a node.
The array containing mappings of nodes to rendered rows.
The id of the node (as would have been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.) to get the row index for.
This operation maps nodes to rowIndexes. It does the opposite job to {@link #getNodeFromRow}.
Return the nodes that are currently selected.
An array containing the nodes that are currently selected.
Returns the column index the model is sorted by. This model is never sorted, so -1 is returned.
-1, to indicate that the model is not sorted.
Get the tree object for which this data model is used.
Get the column in which the tree is to be displayed.
The column in which the tree is to be displayed
the index of the column.
the index of the row.
Returns a cell value by column index.
if the row index is out of bounds.
The value of the cell.
The node to be moved. The node can be represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
The new parent node, which must not be a LEAF. The node can be represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
Move a node in the tree.
If the node object or id is not valid.
If one tries to add a child to a non-existent parent.
If one tries to add a node to a leaf.
The node to be pruned from the tree. The node can be represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
If true then remove the node identified by nodeId as well as all of the children.
Prune the tree by removing, recursively, all of a node’s children. If requested, also remove the node itself.
If the node object or id is not valid.
A node identifier, as previously returned by {@link #addBranch} or {@link #addLeaf}.
The column number to which the provided data applies
The cell data for the specified column
Add data to an additional column (a column other than the tree column) of the tree.
The column of which to set the editable state.
Whether the column should be editable.
Sets whether a column is editable.

Pass either an Array of node objects, or null.

If non-null, nodeArr is an array of node objects containing the entire tree to be displayed. If loading the whole data en bulk in this way, it is assumed that the data is correct! No error checking or validation is done. You’d better know what you’re doing! Caveat emptor.

If nodeArr is null, then this call is a notification that the user has completed building or modifying a tree by issuing a series of calls to {@link #addBranch} and/or {@link #addLeaf}.
Sets the whole data en bulk, or notifies the data model that node modifications are complete.
If the parameter has the wrong type.
Whether all columns are editable.
Sets all columns editable or not editable.
The node to have its attributes set. The node can be represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)

Each property name in the map may correspond to the property names of a node which are specified as USER-PROVIDED ATTRIBUTES in {@link SimpleTreeDataModel}. Each property value will be assigned to the corresponding property of the node specified by nodeId.
Set state attributes of a node.
If the node object or id is not valid.
The tree used to render the data in this model.
Set the tree object for which this data model is used.
The index of the column in which the tree should be displayed.
Specifies which column the tree is to be displayed in. The tree is displayed using the SimpleTreeDataCellRenderer. Other columns may be provided which use different cell renderers.
the column to sort by.
whether to sort ascending.
Sorts the model by a column.
If one tries to sort the tree by column
